ground_truth: Since the two angles together form a line, we have $(x + 26^\circ)+ (2x+10^\circ) = 180^\circ$.  Simplifying gives $3x + 36^\circ = 180^\circ$, so $3x = 144^\circ$ and $x = \boxed{48^\circ}$.

ground_truth: Since the two angles together form a line, we have $(x + 26^\circ)+ (2x+10^\circ) = 180^\circ$.  Simplifying gives $3x + 36^\circ = 180^\circ$, so $3x = 144^\circ$ and $x = \boxed{48^\circ}$.
